info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 2:49PM EDT until July 10 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in an area that experienced heavy rain yesterday. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain have fallen. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in locations where soils are already wet. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Jenkins, Fleming-Neon, Ermine, Colly, Bellcraft, Marlowe, Southdown, Mayking, Sergent, Winters, Farraday, Whitco, Crown, Dongola, Ice, Millstone, Oven Fork, Thornton and Day.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
